programme.title: Highway Cops
programme.desc: There's trouble for speeding tourists who take a corner way too fast, and also for a man who tries to cheat the registration system when he's caught out by his ex-wife. (S4, ep 8)

programme.title: Let's Game

programme.title: Silly Pets
programme.desc: Meet a dog who can't play catch, a strawberry-chomping Chihuahua and Margaret - the fastest hamster in the world! (S1, ep 5)

programme.title: Impossible Animals: Kids
programme.desc: Deserts: Handling the Heat: Desert heat is deadly, so to survive here creatures have made some remarkable adaptations, like a little gecko who drinks by licking its own eyeballs! (S1, ep 1)

programme.title: Isadora Moon
programme.desc: Vampire Talent Show: Isadora wants to perform ballet at a talent show, but worries it's 'unvampirey'. She meets a boy vampire who helps her find the confidence to be herself. (S1, ep 11)

programme.title: Nothing To Declare
programme.desc: Cameras join officers from Australia's airports, harbours and mail services as they protect the nation from drug-smugglers, illegal products and unusual creepy-crawlies. (S10, ep 10)

programme.title: Arctic Secrets
programme.desc: Land Of Extremes: The Arctic is locked in darkness for nearly seven months of the year, but when the sun comes up, the polar region sparkles into life. (S1, ep 1)

programme.title: Gangs Of Baboon Falls
programme.desc: As the Victoria gang struggle with lots of new mouths to feed, the Zambia gang must decide whether to let outcasts from outer town in. (S1, ep 2)

programme.title: Strange Creatures

programme.title: Strange Creatures

programme.title: Monkey Life Specials
programme.desc: New & Exclusive. Learn about the secret life of the slow loris - an unusual nocturnal primate. Monkey World's sister sanctuary Dao Tien have been fighting to save this species. (3 of 3)

programme.title: David Attenborough's First Life
programme.desc: Conquest: Sir David Attenborough explores the beautiful landscapes of Canada's Rocky Mountains, where fossils document an explosion in animal diversity. (2 of 2)

programme.title: Patrick Aryee's Wild World
programme.desc: New & Exclusive. Jaguar: Patrick is in Costa Rica to witness the annual mass nesting of sea turtles, as well as the predatory jaguars that come in for the kill. (S1, ep 3)

programme.title: Big Beasts: Last Of The Giants

programme.title: The Fortune Hotel
programme.desc: A new group of guests have barely touched down before the games begin as host Stephen Mangan welcomes 11 new pairs to the hostelry with a Day Trip Challenge that kicks off on the airport runway. It's a race that involves taxis, boats and the Caribbean Sea. Pairs must retrieve keys to earn their place at the hotel, but who will get a room and who will be at risk of heading home with emotions already running high?

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: James Martin's Midweek Menu
programme.desc: James treats chef Lesley Waters to a dish of pasta and artichokes, and enjoys a dessert of potato and chicory root from Michelin-starred chef Tommy Banks. He gives a masterclass in cooking onions and serves up a mouth-watering coq au vin for Madness singer Suggs and guests Daniel Galmiche, Dipna Anand and Alysia Vasey

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, with Axel Blake, Richard Madeley and Sian Welby all trying to say what they see as they guess well-known phrases for the chance to play for the £50,000 jackpot

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Looking for lingos are housemates Dave and Kimberley from Hull, married couple Adeleen and Joshua from Bedford, and sisters Chinelo and Chioma from London.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: All that stands between Debbie from Cheshire, Rakesh from Stevenage, Sean from Liverpool, Angela from Hampshire and thousands of pounds is the matter of one of the country's finest quiz brains. Bradley Walsh asks the questions, but do they have the answers?

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Mack is determined to cheer up Charity, but she blames herself, Vinny searches for answers, while Vanessa and Manpreet bond over the shared frustrations of their love lives

programme.title: Tom Kerridge Cooks Spain
programme.desc: The chef is on the road in his bespoke vintage food truck in Andalucia. Wine chemist Joaquin explains the patience needed to produce sherry vinegar in the famed sherry triangle, before putting Tom to the test alongside blender Ramon to see if he can produce a blend good enough to match their best vintage. Tom's journey then takes him to Cadiz, where avocados have become big business. There local producer Rafa shows him the work being done to help grow this thirsty plant

programme.title: The Fortune Hotel
programme.desc: The guests tackle a fast and frantic Hotel Game, involving memory, teamwork, and a suitcase full of unexpected items - with the winners gaining a valuable advantage. Then the action moves to the seaside for a Day Trip Challenge. Pairs must collect puzzle pieces from the ocean, assemble a giant jigsaw, and crack a riddle to lock in their position

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Spectre
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Daniel Craig and Christoph Waltz. After foiling a terrorist attack in Mexico City, James Bond picks up the trail of a secret organisation known as Spectre. He infiltrates one of their meetings in Rome, only to discover that his every move has been monitored by Spectre's mysterious leader, a man known as Franz Oberhauser.

programme.title: The Fortune Hotel
programme.desc: The guests tackle a fast and frantic Hotel Game, involving memory, teamwork, and a suitcase full of unexpected items - with the winners gaining a valuable advantage. programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Moonraker
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Roger Moore and Lois Chiles. James Bond is called in to investigate after an Anglo-American "Moonraker" space shuttle disappears during a routine test flight. His mission takes him via Venice to Rio - pursued by the metal-mouthed hitman Jaws - then into the depths of the Amazon jungle, on the trail of evil billionaire Hugo Drax.

programme.title: Lucy Letby: Beyond Reasonable Doubt?
programme.desc: Anouk Curry reports on the conviction of the former nurse, who was found guilty of killing seven newborn babies and attempting to kill seven others in one of the most shocking murder cases in British history. This programme explores the views of a team of international scientists who say the prosecution case simply doesn't stand up to scrutiny. So is she guilty beyond reasonable doubt or could she be a victim of one of Britain's worst miscarriages of justice

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Michelle Collins to talk about a new show of hers, Michael and Gen transform another charity founder, and Katie and JJ try some strength training.

programme.title: Ainsley's Good Mood Food
programme.desc: Ainsley works his way through the veg patch, making dishes filled with tasty vegetables. His first dish is a Harriott house favourite of carrot and cardamom fritters, he then heads to Devon to visit Darts Farm, where he gets a tour of the latest crops from the youngest generation of the family involved in the farm. Joseph meets Sarah from Puckett's Pickles and lends a hand making her family's piccalilli recipe

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Michelle from Chesterfield, Corey from Surrey, Mo from the Vale of Glamorgan and Georgia from Bath pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen present the celebrity cookery contest in which famous faces are mentored by world-class chefs to compete in culinary battles. In the first edition, actress Natalie Cassidy goes head to head with radio presenter Jordan North, and reality stars Jack Osbourne and Jessica Wright go up against each other, attempting to deliver gourmet dishes on a budget of just three pounds per portion. Who will go straight through and which two stars will face each other in the cook-off? Others taking part throughout the series are Hugh Dennis, Ekin-Su Cülcüloglu, Kelly Hoppen and Shaun Wright-Phillips

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Comedian Eddie Kadi joins the pair as Shivi serves up croissant cups for breakfast. The tortoises at the wildlife park have a bath, Shivi heads to the beach to learn about the magnificent crab of the Suffolk coast, and local baker David teaches Jimmy, Shivi and Eddie how to make a crab out of bread

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in his Hampshire kitchen and is serving up a feast of delicious food for model Jodie Kidd while also enjoying recipes from chefs Aktar Islam, Emily Scott, and Corrin Harrison.

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley takes inspiration from the beautiful and clean flavours of Nordic cuisine - his first dish is a traditional laxpudding, a comforting savoury pudding that is perfect for a family meal. After Lisa Snowdon heads to a popular bakery to learn about their cardamon buns before cooking her own dish inspired by her visit in the form of a beetroot gravlax salmon, Ainsley is joined by actor Brian Conley - as he is after a quick cooking lesson - and they make tasty meatballs together

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Ascot
programme.desc: Oli Bell presents coverage of the Shergar Cup from Ascot, where 12 of the top riders from around the world compete in a team event, plus racing from Newmarket and Haydock Park. With analysis from Adele Mulrennan and Hayley Turner, reports by Sally Ann Grassick and Leonna Mayor, and commentary from Mark Johnson

programme.title: Deal or No Deal: Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as 2023 King of the Jungle Sam Thompson tries to open the 22 red boxes in the right order, taking on the infamous banker for the chance to win a cash prize for charity. Sam is supported in the wings by friends, family and a few famous faces, including former I'm a Celebrity campmates

They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: No Time to Die
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Daniel Craig, Rami Malek and Léa Seydoux. After narrowly surviving an attempt on his life, James Bond believes his lover, Madeleine Swann, has betrayed him. Five years later, he is drawn out of retirement and back into her life when a new global threat - a deadly biological weapon - emerges. But with Bond's nemesis, Blofeld, behind bars, who is the mysterious figure intent on using this terrifying new technology?

programme.title: Moonraker

programme.title: Lucy Letby: Beyond Reasonable Doubt?
programme.desc: Anouk Curry reports on the conviction of the former nurse, who was found guilty of killing seven newborn babies and attempting to kill seven others in one of the most shocking murder cases in British history. This programme explores the views of a team of international scientists who say the prosecution case simply doesn't stand up to scrutiny. So is she guilty beyond reasonable doubt or could she be a victim of one of Britain's worst miscarriages of justice

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen present the celebrity cookery contest in which famous faces are mentored by world-class chefs to compete in culinary battles. In the first edition, actress Natalie Cassidy goes head to head with radio presenter Jordan North, and reality stars Jack Osbourne and Jessica Wright go up against each other, attempting to deliver gourmet dishes on a budget of just three pounds per portion. programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
